Export curated or simulated weather data

Source: R/export_weather.R
export_weather.Rd

Writes a weather dataset (observed, imputed, or scenario-based) to a CSV file with standardized metadata for reproducibility.

Usage

export_weather(df, path, meta = NULL, overwrite = TRUE)

Arguments

df

A data frame or tibble containing weather data.

path

File path to write the CSV output.

meta

Named list of metadata fields (optional). Typical fields include: station, scenario, source, and version. If not provided, basic metadata (date and package version) are used.

overwrite

Logical; if TRUE, overwrite existing file (default = TRUE).

Value

Invisibly returns the written file path.

Details

This function behaves like utils::write.csv() but automatically embeds key metadata (station, scenario, package version, and date) as commented header lines at the top of the file.

Examples

data(weather_nl)
tmpfile <- tempfile(fileext = ".csv")
export_weather(
  weather_nl,
  path = tmpfile,
  meta = list(station = "St. John's", scenario = "baseline")
)
#> Weather data exported to /tmp/RtmpXNfmlw/file1dd144b02e.csv
readLines(tmpfile, n = 6)  # view header
#> [1] "# Weather data export"     "# package: climecol 0.1.9"
#> [3] "# date: 2025-10-13"        "# station: St. John's"    
#> [5] "# scenario: baseline"      ""
